description: The `Orchestration & Job Management` subsystem is the core workflow coordinator for CodeBoarding, handling job lifecycle, persistence, and external triggers. It manages the end-to-end workflow, from parsing CLI arguments and initiating job execution to coordinating analysis steps and handling output generation. This subsystem ensures job state is maintained, provides historical records, and integrates with external systems like GitHub Actions for automated analysis and documentation.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: This component serves as the central coordinator for the entire CodeBoarding workflow. It parses CLI arguments, orchestrates the high-level steps of the analysis pipeline, and manages the overall job execution flow from initiation to completion.

components.name: Job Database
components.description: Responsible for persisting job requests, their current status, and results. It ensures job state is maintained across application restarts and provides a historical record of all operations, enabling job tracking and retrieval.

components.name: Output Generation Engine (Diagrams)
components.description: Manages the generation of visual diagrams (e.g., using Mermaid.js) based on the processed analysis results. It is a specialized part of the overall output generation, triggered and coordinated by the Orchestration Engine as part of the documentation workflow.

components.name: External Job Integrator (GitHub Actions)
components.description: Provides specific logic and integration points for initiating or managing CodeBoarding jobs within a GitHub Actions environment. This enables automated analysis and documentation generation as part of CI/CD pipelines.
